summary:
Goalball is a unique sport for visually impaired athletes. Teams of three players throw a bell-filled ball at the opponent's goal, using only their hands. It's played on a volleyball court with 12-minute halves. Players wear eye shades or patches to ensure fairness.

The International Blind Sports Federation (IBSA) governs the sport, ensuring equal opportunities for blind and partially sighted individuals. This inclusive sport requires skill, coordination, and acute hearing to succeed.
title: Goalball
